intro: Julbernardia, commonly known as the African mahogany, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It comprises several species, most of which are native to tropical regions of Africa and Madagascar. The plants are characterized by their large, alternate leaves and showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. They are often found in forested or wooded areas, thriving in humid, well-drained soils. Julbernardia species are valued for their hard, durable wood and are sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
